title: Concomitant access of a single Genomedata archive can lead to undefined behaviour

content.raw:
If any more than a small number of processes attempt to read data from the same archive, undefined behaviour can result. During an attempt to have approximately 100 processes reading from a single archive, only about 10% had any success, and of those 10%, most resulting files had missing data, despite not appearing to have caused any error to be output.

In particular, errors resembling the following frequently result:

```
#!text
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/cviner/cytomod/cytomod/src/cytomod.py", line 433, in <module>
    with Genome(genomeDataArchive) as genome:
  File "/home/cviner/arch/Linux-i686/lib/python2.7/genomedata-1.3.3-py2.7.egg/genomedata/__init__.py", line 151, in __init__
    format_version = self.format_version
  File "/home/cviner/arch/Linux-i686/lib/python2.7/genomedata-1.3.3-py2.7.egg/genomedata/__init__.py", line 427, in format_version
    for chromosome in chromosomes)
  File "/home/cviner/arch/Linux-i686/lib/python2.7/genomedata-1.3.3-py2.7.egg/genomedata/__init__.py", line 426, in <genexpr>
    assert all(res == chromosome._format_version
  File "/home/cviner/arch/Linux-i686/lib/python2.7/genomedata-1.3.3-py2.7.egg/genomedata/__init__.py", line 179, in __iter__
    yield self[filepath.namebase]
  File "/home/cviner/arch/Linux-i686/lib/python2.7/genomedata-1.3.3-py2.7.egg/genomedata/__init__.py", line 212, in __getitem__
    *self.args, **self.kwargs)
  File "/home/cviner/arch/Linux-i686/lib/python2.7/genomedata-1.3.3-py2.7.egg/genomedata/__init__.py", line 594, in _fromfilename
    h5file = _open_file(filepath, mode=mode, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/cviner/arch/Linux-i686/lib/python2.7/genomedata-1.3.3-py2.7.egg/genomedata/__init__.py", line 67, in _open_file
    return openFile(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/cviner/arch/Linux-i686/lib/python2.7/tables/file.py", line 230, in openFile
    return File(filename, mode, title, rootUEP, filters, **kwargs)
  File "/home/cviner/arch/Linux-i686/lib/python2.7/tables/file.py", line 495, in __init__
    self._g_new(filename, mode, **params)
  File "hdf5Extension.pyx", line 317, in tables.hdf5Extension.File._g_new (tables/hdf5Extension.c:3039)
tables.exceptions.HDF5ExtError: HDF5 error back trace

  File "../../src/H5F.c", line 1585, in H5Fopen
    unable to open file
  File "../../src/H5F.c", line 1274, in H5F_open
    unable to open file: time = Thu Aug 21 12:22:07 2014
, name = '/home/cviner/mordor_home/cytomod/experiments/linked-2014-08-18-K562_ModGenome_kV1/archive/chr22.genomedata', tent_flags = 0
  File "../../src/H5FD.c", line 987, in H5FD_open
    open failed
  File "../../src/H5FDsec2.c", line 343, in H5FD_sec2_open
    unable to open file: name = '/home/cviner/mordor_home/cytomod/experiments/linked-2014-08-18-K562_ModGenome_kV1/archive/chr22.genomedata', errno = 1, error message = 'Operation not permitted', flags = 0, o_flags = 0

End of HDF5 error back trace
```

Ideally, parallel read access should depend only upon underlying OS/file-system limitations. Alternatively, an archive locking mechanism could be instituted to prevent this from occurring.
content.html:
If any more than a small number of processes attempt to read data from the same archive, undefined behaviour can result. During an attempt to have approximately 100 processes reading from a single archive, only about 10% had any success, and of those 10%, most resulting files had missing data, despite not appearing to have caused any error to be output.

In particular, errors resembling the following frequently result:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/cviner/cytomod/cytomod/src/cytomod.py", line 433, in <module>
    with Genome(genomeDataArchive) as genome:
  File "/home/cviner/arch/Linux-i686/lib/python2.7/genomedata-1.3.3-py2.7.egg/genomedata/__init__.py", line 151, in __init__
    format_version = self.format_version
  File "/home/cviner/arch/Linux-i686/lib/python2.7/genomedata-1.3.3-py2.7.egg/genomedata/__init__.py", line 427, in format_version
    for chromosome in chromosomes)
  File "/home/cviner/arch/Linux-i686/lib/python2.7/genomedata-1.3.3-py2.7.egg/genomedata/__init__.py", line 426, in <genexpr>
    assert all(res == chromosome._format_version
  File "/home/cviner/arch/Linux-i686/lib/python2.7/genomedata-1.3.3-py2.7.egg/genomedata/__init__.py", line 179, in __iter__
    yield self[filepath.namebase]
  File "/home/cviner/arch/Linux-i686/lib/python2.7/genomedata-1.3.3-py2.7.egg/genomedata/__init__.py", line 212, in __getitem__
    *self.args, **self.kwargs)
  File "/home/cviner/arch/Linux-i686/lib/python2.7/genomedata-1.3.3-py2.7.egg/genomedata/__init__.py", line 594, in _fromfilename
    h5file = _open_file(filepath, mode=mode, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/cviner/arch/Linux-i686/lib/python2.7/genomedata-1.3.3-py2.7.egg/genomedata/__init__.py", line 67, in _open_file
    return openFile(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/cviner/arch/Linux-i686/lib/python2.7/tables/file.py", line 230, in openFile
    return File(filename, mode, title, rootUEP, filters, **kwargs)
  File "/home/cviner/arch/Linux-i686/lib/python2.7/tables/file.py", line 495, in __init__
    self._g_new(filename, mode, **params)
  File "hdf5Extension.pyx", line 317, in tables.hdf5Extension.File._g_new (tables/hdf5Extension.c:3039)
tables.exceptions.HDF5ExtError: HDF5 error back trace

  File "../../src/H5F.c", line 1585, in H5Fopen
    unable to open file
  File "../../src/H5F.c", line 1274, in H5F_open
    unable to open file: time = Thu Aug 21 12:22:07 2014
, name = '/home/cviner/mordor_home/cytomod/experiments/linked-2014-08-18-K562_ModGenome_kV1/archive/chr22.genomedata', tent_flags = 0
  File "../../src/H5FD.c", line 987, in H5FD_open
    open failed
  File "../../src/H5FDsec2.c", line 343, in H5FD_sec2_open
    unable to open file: name = '/home/cviner/mordor_home/cytomod/experiments/linked-2014-08-18-K562_ModGenome_kV1/archive/chr22.genomedata', errno = 1, error message = 'Operation not permitted', flags = 0, o_flags = 0

End of HDF5 error back trace

Ideally, parallel read access should depend only upon underlying OS/file-system limitations. Alternatively, an archive locking mechanism could be instituted to prevent this from occurring.
